forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. Southwest wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon unfolds over Downtown San Francisco with a serene clarity, the sun gently casting a warm light across the skyline. Highs near 64 degrees beckon locals to step outside, as a light breeze rustles the leaves, hinting at the coolness that accompanies the Pacific’s embrace. Though temperatures will soon retreat to a comfortable 61, one can enjoy the moment before clouds drift in, softening the vivid blue above.

As daylight wanes, clouds gather, portending a slight chance of rain well after nightfall, but for now, the atmosphere teems with possibility. With the promise of a 20% chance of light precipitation, evening excursions might require a light jacket, perhaps favoring layers to adjust as the temperature dips to around 53. In this pleasant interlude, consider venturing to one of the cozy cafés nestled in quaint neighborhoods, or perhaps taking a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero, where the glimmering bay dances with the last light of the day. The fog may not be a presence now, but as twilight descends, the marine layer could gently roll in, setting a tranquil mood over the city.
